definition: lit. a lamb in a tiger's den (idiom)/fig. to tread dangerous ground
sheep/goat/CL:頭|头[tou2],隻|只[zhi1]
surname Yang
to enter/to go into/to join/to become a member of/to confirm or agree with/abbr. for 入聲|入声[ru4 sheng1]
tiger/CL:隻|只[zhi1]
mouth/classifier for things with mouths (people, domestic animals, cannons, wells etc)/classifier for bites or mouthfuls
to show the wolf into the house (idiom)/to introduce a potential source of trouble
to walk right into the trap
lit. to let the tiger return to the mountain; fig. to store up future calamities
to follow the path to one's own doom (idiom)/to bring about one's own destruction
to catch a turtle in a jar (idiom); to set oneself an easy target/a turkey shoot
leaving the door open invites the thief (idiom); to invite disaster by giving evildoers a free hand
what's gone can never come back

definition: to lure the tiger from its domain in the mountains (idiom)/to lure an enemy away from his territory
lit. please Sir, get into the boiling pot (idiom)/fig. to give sb a taste of his own medicine
to bring trouble on oneself
facing imminent catastrophe/calamity looms/all hell will break loose
to confess without being pressed/to make a confession without duress
to have bad intentions
to beat sb at their own game (idiom)
lit. to strike a stone with egg (idiom); to attempt the impossible/to invite disaster by overreaching oneself
